intro: Cyclosorus pseudoaridus, commonly known as the desert liverwort, is a small, terrestrial liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has a thalloid structure with a distinct, flat, greenish to reddish thallus that is often covered in a layer of fine, hair-like structures. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Cyclosorus pseudoaridus plays a minor but ecologically significant role in stabilizing soil in its harsh habitat.
